citation.article-title: Catellicoccus marimammalium gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel Gram-positive, catalase-negative, coccus-shaped bacterium from porpoise and grey seal.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Catellicoccus (Ca.tel′li.coc′cus. L. fem. n. catella small chain; N.L. masc. n. coccus from Gr. masc. n. kokkos berry; N.L. masc. n. Catellicoccus coccus forming small chains).
Cells are Gram-positive, non-spore-forming and coccoid in shape.
Cells are arranged in pairs or chains.
Cells are non-motile, facultatively anaerobic and catalase-negative.
Do not grow in conventional laboratory liquid media with or without serum.
Arginine dihydrolase and leucine arylamidase are produced.
Pyroglutamic acid arylamidase and alkaline phosphatase are not produced.
Aesculin and hippurate are not hydrolysed.
Cell-wall murein is based on l-lys–gly–d-Asp (type A4α).
The type species is Catellicoccus marimammalium; the G+C content of genomic DNA of the type species is 38 mol%.
